page.title: 17ECOLOGY - CANAL WILDLIFE
page.content: Although at first sight, the canal looks rather green and uninviting, its 11 mile length contains a substantial collection of wildlife. We found {water-boatmen, snails, water fleas, {freshwater shrimps, frogs, toads, {tadpoles, beetles, caddisfly larvae, {dragonfly larvae, spiders, {water-scorpions, leeches}and other unidentified species. In the middle of our transect are found the larger fish like{tench, {perch, roach, pike, bream}and{rudd. Along the canal banks and hedges we found{nettles, bracken, grasses, {clover, dock leaves}and{chervil. Amongst these plants we noticed many {damselflies, dragonflies, bees, wasps, {hornets}and{ladybirds. The canal also provides a habitat for{coots, moorhens, swans}and, now, an increasing number of{ducks.
